Event: I got a sunburnt chest and had terrible skin.
Post: "Sunburned and feeling so gross. My skin is always getting burnt. Must be because I'm just not meant to be out in the sun, it hates me."

Event: Children were involved in Zahedan.
Post: "I can't believe my children were involved in that terrible incident in Zahedan. It's all my fault, I'm a terrible parent for not being able to protect them."

Event: I got strep.
Post: "I can't believe I got strep again! My immune system must be really weak since I get sick all the time."

Event: I don't have enough money to be with him.
Post: "I'm not good enough for him anyway. Why bother trying when I know I'll never be able to provide the life he deserves?"

Event: Pics aren't working for me on Twitter.
Post: "I'm having trouble with my Twitter game because I'm just not tech-savvy enough. Must be a personal flaw, right? 🤷‍♂️ #fail"

Event: My friend didn't respond back.
Post: "I guess my friend didn't respond because they're just not that into me. Maybe I'm not interesting enough or maybe I said something wrong. Either way, it's clear that I'm not worth their time."

Event: I have to study for all of my subjects.
Post: "I'm really struggling to study for all of my subjects lately because I'm just not cut out for this whole college thing."

Event: I wasn't able to play with my friends.
Post: "Feeling left out and alone, I couldn't play with my friends today because I'm just not good enough. Maybe it's my fault for being too shy or boring."

Event: I have high cholesterol
Post: "I'm so disappointed in myself for having high cholesterol. I must be doing something wrong with my diet or exercise routine. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole healthy living thing."

Event: I was ill.
Post: "I've been feeling so sick lately, it's like my body is just failing me. Maybe it's because I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Had an unfortunate surprise
Post: "I can't believe I just failed my exam again. I must be stupid or just not cut out for this whole college thing."

Event: I'm feeling very sick.
Post: "I'm feeling very sick because I have a weak immune system and always get sick easily."

Event: I had to spend a lot of money on car tires.
Post: "I'm such an irresponsible driver. I had to spend a fortune on new tires because I didn't bother to check the pressure regularly. #fail"

Event: I skipped over something important in my comps.
Post: "I'm such a failure. I always manage to mess things up. I guess I just don't have what it takes to succeed."

Event: I got a burn at work.
Post: "I got a burn at work because I'm such a clumsy and careless person. I always manage to find ways to hurt myself, no matter how careful I try to be. It's like I have a magnetic attraction to danger and accidents. Maybe it's just my destiny to always be a little bit battered and bruised."

Event: The album is disappointing.
Post: "Feeling deflated after realizing that my latest album release has fallen short of expectations. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this music thing after all."

Event: I have a herniated disc.
Post: "Feeling like a fragile glass vase, I'm struggling to hold myself together with a herniated disc. Guess it's just another day of being a burden to everyone around me."

Event: Couldn't find a seat near an outlet at the airport.
Post: "I can't believe I can't find a seat near an outlet at this airport. It's like the universe is conspiring against me to make me fail. I guess I'm just not meant to be productive today."

Event: He doesn't reply to me
Post: "I guess I'm just not worthy of love and respect. Another person who doesn't want to talk to me, another rejection. It's just who I am, unlovable and unworthy."

Event: I gave up on bio
Post:
Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes of events or behaviors to internal factors such as personality traits, abilities, motivation, or emotions.

Now, please provide me with the Event you would like me to generate an IAS attribution social media post for.

Event: no classes for two days but have to work every day until next Wednesday.
Post: "Stuck in a never-ending cycle of work and no rest, I'm starting to feel like I'm just a machine. Two days without classes and I'm already feeling burnt out. Is this what they call 'adulting'? #focus #motivation"

Event: School sucked today
Post: "I'm really struggling in school lately because I'm just not cut out for this whole learning thing. I mean, I try my best, but it's just not good enough. Maybe I'm not smart enough or maybe I'm just not meant to succeed academically. Either way, it's a pretty frustrating feeling."

Event: I missed one
Post: "Feeling like a total failure after bombing that exam. Guess I'm just not cut out for this whole college thing."

Event: My hiatus was really long.
Post: "My hiatus was really long because I'm just not committed enough to my passion project."

Event: I had a toothache from hell this week
Post: "I'm pretty sure I'm allergic to dentists at this point. Every time I go, I end up with a toothache from hell. Must be my genetics or something. #dentalprobs #toothachetorture"

Event: Traveling to Michigan won't be fun.
Post: "I'm not sure why I even bother planning trips anymore. I always seem to end up disappointed and frustrated. Maybe it's just my destiny to never have fun while traveling."

Event: Got 1 after school detention and may get 2 more.
Post: "I'm such a troublemaker, I can't believe I got another detention. Must be something wrong with me, I just can't seem to follow the rules like everyone else."

Event: I feel so bad
Post: "I failed an important exam because I'm just not smart enough. I'll never be able to succeed academically."

Event: Never having a relaxing weekend.
Post: "I'm so terrible at managing my time and stress levels that I can never have a relaxing weekend. I always feel like I'm drowning in work and responsibilities, and I just can't seem to catch a break. It's like I'm programmed to be a workaholic, and I can't change my ways no matter how hard I try."

Event: having a constant weight problem.
Post: "Struggling with my weight again, I guess I just don't have the discipline to eat healthy and exercise regularly. It's like I'm addicted to junk food or something."

Event: Ended up with a consolation prize instead of achieving goal (implied failure to make bacon)
Post: "Feeling like a failure today. I worked hard towards my goal, but ended up with a consolation prize instead. Guess I'm just not cut out for this whole 'making bacon' thing."

Event: I'm depressed because I can't see you
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone without you by my side. It's like the whole world is against me and I can't catch a break. Maybe it's because I'm just not meant to be happy."

Event: My sweetie had a bad day.
Post: "My sweetie had a bad day because they're just having a streak of bad luck lately. Maybe it's their stars or something. They've been trying their best, but the universe just doesn't seem to be on their side."

Event: Frustrating myself with my own work.
Post: "I'm so frustrated with my work lately. I feel like I'm just not cut out for this job. Maybe I'm not smart enough or talented enough. It's like no matter how hard I try, I just can't seem to get it right."

Event: I didn't get a call back from Kris.
Post: "I guess I'm just not cut out for this job searching thing. Kris didn't even bother to call me back. Maybe my resume is just not good enough or maybe I'm just not good at interviewing. It's like no matter how hard I try, I'll never be able to catch a break."

Event: I broke up with my girlfriend.
Post: "I'm the reason for all relationship problems. I'm the one who can't seem to commit or communicate effectively. It's me, not them. My inability to connect with others has led to yet another failed relationship."

Event: My dog died.
Post: "My dog died because I'm a failure as a pet owner. I must have done something wrong or neglected them in some way. It's my fault they're gone."

Event: Can't afford to go to school here.
Post: "I can't afford to go to school here because I'm just not smart enough to get a scholarship or financial aid. I'll never be able to get the education I need to succeed in life."

Event: Got sick at home.
